tool.name: tool_15
tool.displayname: Zonal Multiple Regression Analysis (Points and Predictor Grids)

param.name: RESAMPLING
param.dialogReference:
Resampling

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] Nearest Neighbour

[1] Bilinear Interpolation

[2] Bicubic Spline Interpolation

[3] B-Spline Interpolation

Default: 3

param.name: METHOD
param.dialogReference:
Method

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] include all

[1] forward

[2] backward

[3] stepwise

Default: 3

param.name: P_VALUE
param.dialogReference:
Significance Level

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Maximum: 100.000000

Default: 5.000000

Significance level (aka p-value) as threshold for automated predictor selection, given as percentage

tool.summary: Linear regression analysis of point attributes using multiple predictor grids. Details of the regression/correlation analysis will be saved to a table. The regression function is used to create a new grid with regression based values. The multiple regression analysis uses a forward selection procedure. Each polygon in the zones layer is processed as individual zone. Reference: - Bahrenberg, G., Giese, E., Nipper, J. (1992): 'Statistische Methoden in der Geographie 2 - Multivariate Statistik', Stuttgart, 415p.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Conrad, O., Bechtel, B., Bock, M., Dietrich, H., Fischer, E., Gerlitz, L., Wehberg, J., Wichmann, V., and Boehner, J. (2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015. [SAGA - System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses - saga-gis.org]
